item.title: Justice Delayed? Emefiele's Trial Hits Another Roadblock as EFCC Witnesses are Rejected
item.description:
The Samony Podcast delves into the recent FCT High Court decision to reject key EFCC witnesses in the high-profile trial of former CBN Governor, Godwin Emefiele. We explore the procedural reasons behind this significant setback for the prosecution, the implications for the ongoing case, and what it means for justice in Nigeria, with the trial now adjourned to January 2026.
Hosts: Host: Oga Titus (Boss), Co-Host: Sodiq (Street)
Category: Politics

item.title: Bandits, Schools & Blame Games: Nigeria's Insecurity Crisis
item.description:
Opposition parties in Nigeria are fiercely criticizing the Federal Government for allegedly negotiating with bandits and for the widespread closure of schools due to insecurity. This episode delves into the arguments against these government actions, the devastating impact on education, and the broader implications for national security and public trust.
